page.title: 01The landscape of Great Orton
page.content: The area consists of a large village and several small hamlets. Great Orton is the main village and lies 5 miles south west of Carlisle in Cumbria. The hamlets of Woodhouses, Orton Rigg and Baldwinter lie to the south of the village. Scenghmire is in the east of the block. The land is mainly flat and lies about 300 ft above sea level. It is an area of fields and some woodland From one of the fields near the village, at least 15 churches in Cumbria and South Scotland, can be seen on a clear day. This field is known as Parson's Thorn.Many of the fields have names, such as Goose Skye and Fun Field. Opposite the school is a stretch of village green known as common land. Farmers were allowed to graze their animals here and at Barras Gate to the north of the village.
